newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Colombia strike not hitting coffee price - minister.
newsitem.headline: Colombia strike not hitting coffee price - minister.

text.p: Colombian Foreign Minister Maria Emma Mejia said labour unrest at the country's main coffee-loading port had not affected prices.
"I think the (high) price is due to the current market situation," she told Reuters during a visit to Brussels. "The port situation is not what is causing the price rise.
Robusta coffee futures have soared by nearly 16 percent this week but premiums for arabica -- Colombia's main crop -- have held steady on the back of a dock workers strike at Buanaventura port.
The strike ended on Thursday, nine days after stevedores stopped work to press for higher handling fees.
"I am glad to hear the strike is over, but hope prices will hold up still," said Mejia, in Brussels for trade talks with European Commission officials.
